events.title: Birth of George Washington
events.description: George Washington, the first President of the United States and a Founding Father, was born in Westmoreland County, Virginia.
events.significance: Washington's leadership helped establish the United States as a new nation and set precedents for the presidency.

events.title: Spain cedes Florida to the United States (Adams-Onís Treaty)
events.description: Spain formally ceded Florida to the United States following the Adams-Onís Treaty signed in 1819, which settled border disputes between the two countries.
events.significance: This treaty significantly expanded U.S. territory and clarified the boundary between U.S. and Spanish holdings.

events.title: President Roosevelt orders Japanese Americans into internment camps
events.description: Following the attack on Pearl Harbor, President Franklin D. Roosevelt signed Executive Order 9066, which authorized the internment of Japanese Americans during World War II.
events.significance: The order led to the forced relocation and incarceration of thousands of Japanese Americans, a significant event in U.S. civil rights history.

events.title: Miracle on Ice: The U.S. hockey team defeats the Soviet Union
events.description: During the Winter Olympics, the amateur U.S. men's ice hockey team defeated the dominant Soviet team in a major upset.
events.significance: This game became a symbolic victory during the Cold War and a celebrated moment in American sports history.
